isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 5000, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - CLUTCH PEDAL SHAFT BEARING REPLACEMENT

svcprocinfo.para: The procedures outlined below should be followed when replacement of the clutch pedal, clutch pedal shaft or pedal shaft bearings is required ( Figure 4).

step1.para: Open the hood.
Remove the cotter and yoke pins and disconnect the control rod from the pedal shaft lever.
Scribe aligning marks on the lever and shaft to assure correct reassembly.
Remove the lever clamp bolt and remove the lever from the shaft.
Remove the lever spacer from the shaft.
Remove the sound insulator panel from under the instrument panel.
Remove the pedal return spring.
Scribe aligning marks on the pedal and shaft to assure correct reassembly.
Remove the pedal clamp bolt and remove the pedal from the shaft.
Remove the retaining bolts holding the bearing assemblies to the steering column bracket and the dash panel (engine tunnel).
Withdraw the end of the shaft through the hole in the dash panel (engine tunnel) and remove the shaft and bearing assemblies.

caution.para: Do not damage wiring or piping under instrument panel when removing shaft. To prevent electrical "shorts," disconnect battery ground cable before removing pedal shaft.

step1.para: Remove the bearing assemblies from shaft. Discard the worn bearing assemblies.
Inspect the shaft. Replace if worn or damaged.
Inspect the pedal stop. Replace if worn or damaged.
Inspect the pedal return spring. Replace if stretched, worn or damaged.
Position the bearing assemblies on the shaft.
Position the shaft (with bearing assemblies) in the vehicle.
Install the bearing assembly retaining bolts. Tighten to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m).
Position the pedal on the shaft. (Align scribed marks for correct position.)
Install the pedal clamp bolt. Tighten the bolt to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m).
Position the lever spacer on the shaft.
Position lever on shaft. (Align scribed marks for correct position.)
Slide the lever onto the shaft until end play is removed. Shaft must operate freely.
Install the lever clamp bolt and tighten to 18 to 22 ft-lbs. (24 to 30 N•m).
Install the clutch pedal return spring.
Install the sound insulation panel under the instrument panel.
Close the hood.
